item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 17, 2024 at 11:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. All-in-one embedding model for interleaved text, images, and screenshots (76 points | 6 comments)
2. CSS gets a new logo and it uses the color `rebeccapurple` (391 points | 75 comments)
3. Constraints in Go (25 points | 10 comments)
4. The Bluesky firehose viewed in the style of a Windows XP screensaver (284 points | 70 comments)
5. James Gleick's Chaos: The Software (154 points | 12 comments)
6. Show HN: I built a(nother) house optimized for LAN parties (704 points | 251 comments)
7. How we made a Ruby method 200x faster (10 points | 1 comment)
8. Teach yourself to echolocate (149 points | 38 comments)
9. SICP: The only computer science book worth reading twice? (2010) (338 points | 133 comments)
10. Two galaxies aligned in a way where their gravity acts as a compound lens (222 points | 70 comments)
11. Recovering from a kidney donation (19 points | 13 comments)
12. Effect of a giant meteorite impact on Paleoarchean environment and life (108 points | 42 comments)
13. Unit Testing Numerical Routines (12 points | discuss)
14. Gemini AI tells the user to die (36 points | 30 comments)
15. James Webb Space Telescope finds evidence for alternate theory of gravity (290 points | 123 comments)
16. King Arthur's ancient trail across Britain (22 points | 14 comments)
17. Logica – Declarative logic programming language for data (124 points | 48 comments)
18. Appreciation of the mark-all-as-read button (37 points | 17 comments)
19. Yggdrasil Network (272 points | 92 comments)
20. Statistical Rethinking (2024 Edition) (149 points | 26 comments)
21. One-parting some Commodore 64 utilities for fun and profit (21 points | 3 comments)
22. I tried every top email marketing tool (178 points | 89 comments)
23. When Abstractions Break (15 points | 2 comments)
24. Resolving a mysterious problem with find (16 points | 21 comments)
25. Xogot – Godot for iPad (87 points | 19 comments)
26. SmoothLLM: Defending Large Language Models Against Jailbreaking Attacks (40 points | 13 comments)
27. Numpyro: Probabilistic programming with NumPy powered by Jax (96 points | 24 comments)
28. Optimizers: The Low-Key MVP (103 points | 7 comments)
29. Two Nobel Prize winners want to cancel their own CRISPR patents in Europe (72 points | 44 comments)
30. Don't Look Twice: Faster Video Transformers with Run-Length Tokenization (64 points | 12 comments)
